markdownRemark.html:
Matrix Factorization is a simple way to do collaborative filtering.

MN1×N2=UN1×dVd×N2M_{N_1\times N2}=U_{N_1\times d}V_{d\times N_2}MN1​×N2​=UN1​×d​Vd×N2​​

The main idea is that d≪min(N1,N2)d \ll min(N_1, N_2)d≪min(N1​,N2​) and is smaller than the rank of MMM. Actually, it is equivalent to learn a low rank matrix (with rank ddd) that is similar to MMM.

The reason why we can learn such a low rank matrix is that:

  • We assume many columns in MMM should look similar
  • MMM is sparse and we can use the low rank matrix to fill the missing data.
